metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28677 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 8.2.0. For EPS data, the readline implementation used in EPSImageFile has to deal with any combination of \r and \n as line endings. It used an accidentally quadratic method of accumulating lines while looking for a line ending. A malicious EPS file could use this to perform a DoS of Pillow in the open phase, before an image was accepted for opening.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
python-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
python3-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
python3-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6').
